p: It is worth mentioning that the extraction conditions play an important role in determining the composition of the volatiles. For example, while no significant differences were observed in alcoholic volatiles such as hexanol at 20 °C, increasing the extraction temperature to 50 °C resulted in a significant increase in alcoholic volatiles, such as α-terpineol. Therefore, US can increase the volatile extraction efficiency of medium-to-low volatiles compounds in herbs [9]. The combined use of US and heat treatment using a thermosonication method improved the extracted essential oil efficiency and extracted yield from clove (53 kHz and 52 °C) [ 38]. Also, time savings have been reported for the US processing where Gavahian, Farhoosh, Javidnia, Shahidi, Golmakani and Farahnaky [ 89] reported of reducing essential oil extraction time by 17% for peppermint herb.
